ibis.deploy
Class Deploy

java.lang.Object
  ibis.deploy.Deploy

public class Deploy
extends java.lang.Object

Main entry point for ibis-deploy framework. Allows users to deploy jobs and start hubs on a jungle.

Author:
Niels Drost

Constructor Detail

Deploy

public Deploy(java.io.File home,
              boolean verbose,
              int port,
              Resource serverResource,
              StateListener serverListener,
              boolean blockOnServer)
       throws java.lang.Exception
Create a new deployment interface. Also deploys the server, either locally or remotely.

Parameters:
home - "home" directory of ibis-deploy. If null, the default location is used from the "ibis.deploy.home" system property. If this property is unspecified, final default value is the current working directory.
verbose - If true, start Ibis-Deploy in verbose mode
port - port used to bind local hub/server to. Defaults to automatically allocated free port.
serverResource - resource where the server should be started, or null for a server embedded in this JVM.
serverListener - callback object for status of server
blockOnServer - if true, will block until the server is running
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if required files cannot be found in home, or the server cannot be started.
Method Detail

Returns whether monitoring is enabled

Returns:
true if monitoring is enabled

setKeepSandboxes

public void setKeepSandboxes(boolean keepSandboxes)
If set to true, will keep all sandboxes for jobs. This is turned off by default

Parameters:
keepSandboxes - if true, ibis-deploy will keep all sandboxes for jobs from now on.

submitJob

public Job submitJob(JobDescription description,
                     Application application,
                     Resource resource,
                     StateListener jobListener,
                     StateListener hubListener)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Submit a new job.

Parameters:
description - description of the job.
application - application for job
resource - resource to use
hubListener - listener for state of hub
jobListener - listener for state of job
Returns:
the resulting job
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getHub

public Server getHub(Resource resource,
                     boolean waitUntilRunning,
                     StateListener listener)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a hub on the specified resource. If a hub does not exist on the resource, one is submitted. May not be running (yet).

Parameters:
resource - resource to deploy the hub on
waitUntilRunning - wait until hub is actually running
listener - listener for state of hub
Returns:
reference to a hub on the given resource
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the hub cannot be started

                                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a map containing the size of each pool at the server

Returns:
a map containing the size of each pool at the server. May be empty if the server could not be reached

java.lang.Exception

getLocations

                                throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a map containing all locations of a pool at the server

Returns:
a map containing all locations of a pool at the server
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the server is not running yet, or communicating with it failed

getJobs

public Job[] getJobs()

waitUntilJobsFinished

public void waitUntilJobsFinished()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Waits until all jobs are finished. If any jobs are submitted while waiting, will not wait on those.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if one of the jobs failed.

end

public void end()
Ends all jobs and closes all open connections. Parameter indicates whether a message is to be printed (yes when using GUI, no when CLI).
